Welcome to RestAPIz14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

Main module for mega-super-duper Rest API

async main.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶
async main.root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Users¶

User operation module contains methods to create new user, get user name by e-mail and etc. Users module contains a method to extract user by an email from a database Users module contains a method to create a user in a database, to get user avatar by his/her email Users module contains a method to update user token in a database Users module contains a method to confirm a user email in a database Users module contains a method to update user avatar in a database

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Returns confirmed email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email to be confirmed.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The confirmed email.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user with the specific avatar with the specified email of the user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the User to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified id for the specific user with the specified email of the user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Returns updated avatar with the specified email of the user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • url (str) – The url of the user avatar.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated avatar.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Returns updated token for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (Union[str, None]) – The token of the user to be updated.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated token.

Return type:

None

REST API repository Contacts¶

Contact operation module contains methods to create new contact, get contact and other CRUD type operations.

Contacts module contains calculation of the age of a person ahead Contacts module checks if there is a birthday of a person within the given days ahead Contacts module contains a method to extract the user contact from database and put it on the list of the users who have birthdays within the given days ahead Contacts module contains a method to create a list of the users contacts, limited to the given records limit number and with the ability to omit the given number of records. Contacts module contains a method to extract a user contact from a database Contacts module contains a method to extract notes of the first user contact from a database Contacts module contains a method to create a contacts list of contacts filtered by email from a database Contacts module contains a method to create a contacts list of contacts filtered by a first name from a database Contacts module contains a method to create a contacts list of contacts filtered by a last name from a database Contacts module contains a method to create a contacts list of contacts filtered by first and last name from a database Contacts module contains a method to create a user contact, to add it to a database and to refresh a database Contacts module contains a method to remove a user contact by contact id from a database Contacts module contains a method to update a user contact by contact id in a database Contacts module contains a method to update notes of a user contact by contact id in a database

src.repository.contacts.age_in_years_for_days_ahead(birthday, next_days: int = 0)¶

Returns the age of the user within the given days ahead.

Parameters:

  • birthday (date) – The birthday of the user.

  • next_days (int) – The number of days to calculate birthday.

Returns:

The age of the user who has birthday within the given days ahead.

Return type:

int

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactBase) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified id for the specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The id of a user.

  • user (User) – The user to update the notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_notes(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

Retrieves a list of notes with the specified id for the specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The id of a user.

  • user (User) – The user to update the notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated notes.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with the specified id for the specific user with the specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to get contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthday_ahead(days: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with the specified id for the specific user with birthday within the given days.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – The number of days ahead to calculate birthday.

  • user (User) – The user with birthday to get contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

  • user (User) – The user to get contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to get contacts for.

  • next_days (int) – The number of days to calculate birthday.

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single user contact with the specified id for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The id of a user.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contacts or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

  • body (ContactBase) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

  • notes (str) – The updated contact notes.

  • user (User) – The user to update the notes for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated notes or None if it does not exist.
